file_content.text: Yes, hmm? Can I help you with something? Hmm?
Do I have the correct man? Security expert Zee?
Are you Zee?
I'm sorry, I'm afraid I don't have any time to talk right now.
I'm looking for some security advice.
Just want to chat.
Security advice? I'm sorry, I'm afraid I don't have time for that right now.
If you'll excuse me. Hmm?
I just need the codes to Eidolon Security's encryption programs.
Cooperate, this will go easy.
Look, give me the encryption data for Eidolon Security and do it now.
I don't have time for this.
You've got codes for Eidolon Security. You give them to me, or I shoot you in the leg.
Let's get violent, shall we?
There is no need for that! Please calm down.
You realize you are talking about the Eidolon? Hmm? You know what a grave error you're making?
I want all of the data on Eidolon Security's encryption programs--now.
Give me the Eidolon's codes.
Hmm. You seem a very intelligent individual. Do you understand the grave error you're making? Hmm?
If you tamper with Eidolon Security, you'll meet the Eidolon. If that happens, you will die. Please don't do this. Hmm?
You don't want to resist me on this one.
Hand over the codes.
I'm quite eager to meet the Eidolon.
Bring him on.
You're seconds away from a messy death.
You want to die?
Hmm, there's a problem. You see, if I give you Eidolon Security's codes, the Eidolon will pay me a visit. And I'm sure to die if that happens.
Although, mathematically speaking, even a slightly prolonged existence is rather more logical.
If I hand over the codes, will you let me live? Hmm?
Will you keep quiet about our little chat?
If you can stay silent.
If I tell Eidolon Security you have their codes, it would only hasten my meeting with the Eidolon. That is, therefore, not a logical choice. Hmm?
Only one way to find out.
Maybe.
I calculate I have a low probability of survival. I have been wrong before. I hope this is one of those times.
If you don't, you'll die for sure.
I'm getting trigger happy....
Hmm. That much does seem certain. It appears I have no other alternative.
Here are the codes. But I must say, they won't make a difference. Eidolon Security's mercenaries and sentry droids are the best on Nar Shaddaa.
I calculate a very high probability that we will not meet again. Hmm?
Our business is done. Don't make me come back.
Get out of here.
Going.
With a little good fortune, maybe the Eidolon will die before he gets to you.
Good luck, Zee.
Hmm. Luck is a random factor in probability. Given what I've done, my fate will hardly be random.
This will be our only meeting.
Correct. [Kill Zee]
I hate... being right... all the time....
Hmm? I'm rather busy at the moment. If you would excuse me.
